questions.question: CPR stands for:

choices.answer: Cardiac, Pressure, Revive
Cardio, Pulmonary, Resuscitation
Care, Pressure, Revive
Cardio, Pressure, Restore

questions.question: Before approaching an unresponsive person:

choices.answer: check for bleeding from the ears and nose
look for items to splint possible fractures
check the scene for hazards
begin rescue breaths immediately

questions.question: . Determine unresponsiveness by:

choices.answer: rolling the person onto his or her side (recovery position)
splashing water on the personâ€™s face
tapping the person and asking, "Are you ok?"
tilting the head back

questions.question: How many chest compressions should be given before rescue breaths?
What is the difference between a heart attack and cardiac arrest?

choices.answer: heart attack victim are conscious and cardiac arrest victim are unconscious
HA victims heart has stopped and CA victims breathing has stopped
HA victims heart has stopped, CA victims breathing and heart rate has stop
none of the above are differences

questions.question: How many rescue breaths should be given after chest compressions:
Where should you place your hands when giving chest compressions:

choices.answer: 2 inches below the breastbone
On the stomach above the navel
on breastbone in the center of the chest; middle finger inline w/ nipples
On either side of the breastbone

questions.question: Continue CPR until:

choices.answer: the person begins breathing, cries, or moves
trained help takes over
rescuer becomes too tired or dizzy to continue CPR
all of these options are correct

questions.question: To care for an alert chocking adult or child:

choices.answer: open the airway and begin rescue breathing
wait until the person becomes unresponsive to provide care
give abdominal thrusts until the object is removed or they go unconscious
begin chest compressions

questions.question: Which of the following is a sign of a stroke:

choices.answer: shoulder and jaw pain
Paralysis of one side of the face (facial droop)
chest discomfort
upset stomach

questions.question: What do you do after shock is delivered to the person?

choices.answer: resume CPR starting with compressions
Resume CPR starting with rescue breaths
resume CPR by opening the person's airway
do not resume CPR

questions.question: How can you keep yourself safe from air-borne and blood-borne diseases?

choices.answer: wear gloves, take them off inside out, and dispose of them in bio hazard
never touch your eyes, nose, mouth during or after caring for victim
use hand sanitizer on hands/arms until running water & antibacterial soap
all of the above

questions.question: When assessing for a heart attack, consider:

choices.answer: age of the person
age of person; pain in chest/arms/neck/jaw; nausea and dizziness > 10 min
Give them aspirin and see if victim feels better
None of the above are valid options

questions.question: To control bleeding:

choices.answer: layer guaze pads w/ pressure&call911 if bleeding doesn't stop after 10min
pour alcohol on wound and scrub hard
pour peroxide on wound and scrub hard
change bandages when soaked with blood

questions.question: EPI Pens should be used only when a victim displays what symptoms?

choices.answer: Itchy rash on arms
facial swelling that may cause difficulty or inability to breathe
hives on chest on abdomen
All of the options above are good reasons to use an Epi Pen

questions.question: If an AED arrives during CPR and you've completed 5 sets 30:2 (2 min) for child:

choices.answer: complete the chest compressions
complete the rescue breaths
open the airway
use the AED immediately if child is over 1 year old

questions.question: How fast should you give chest compressions?

choices.answer: 60 per minute
As fast as you can
To the beat of the Bee Gee song "Stayin' Alive"
1 compression every 2 seconds

questions.question: CPR is used for people who are:

choices.answer: severely bleeding
unresponsive,showing no movement in chest-heart rate breathing have stopped
have asthma
who have chronic obstructive lung disease

questions.question: You have determined that a person is unresponsive and have sent a bystander to call the EMS - What do you do next?

choices.answer: position the person facedown
begin chest compressions
open the airway
chest circulation

questions.question: An example of negligence is:

choices.answer: cracking victims ribs while doing compressions
using an Epi-pen without getting victim's parents consent
throwing away a used Epi-pen in the regular trash can
Doing CPR on an unconscious choking victim without getting consent

questions.question: If no shock is advised:

choices.answer: give5sets of chest compressions&rescue breaths; allow AED to evaluate again
the person is responsive
do not give chest compressions
shock the person anyway

questions.question: What is the purpose of an AED?

choices.answer: to start the person breathing again
to defibrillate the heart and reunite all the pacer maker cells
to stop brain impulses to the body
to open heart valves

questions.question: What is Ventricular Fibrillation?

choices.answer: early cardiac arrest
heart is no longer able to pump blood to the body
pacemaker cells are no longer in perfect rhythm
all the options describe ventricular fibrillation
